data: Claude-André Faucher-Giguère Claude-André Faucher-Giguère Associate Professor Ph.D, Harvard University, 2010 cgiguere@northwestern.edu 847-467-4647 1800 Sherman #8067 Prof. Claude-André Faucher-Giguère has broad interests in theoretical astrophysics and cosmology, with particular emphasis on galaxy formation and evolution. Faucher-Giguère's research focuses on understanding the multi-scale physical processes that govern galaxy formation in the cosmological context, including star formation, galaxy-black hole co-evolution, galactic dynamics, and connections with the intergalactic medium and cosmology. He uses a multi-pronged approach including: large-scale numerical simulations, analytic modeling, and comparisons with observational data. Prof. Faucher-Giguère holds a courtesy appointment at Argonne National Laboratory, where he collaborates with the Cosmological Physics and Advanced Computing group.
